meanings.definition: To make someone feel excited or enthusiastic.
meanings.sent1: The surprise party really galed her.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling roller coaster ride galed the children.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks galed the audience into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset galed everyone with its colors.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display galed the night sky with bursts of light.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel happy or satisfied.
meanings.sent1: Winning the game galed him beyond words.
meanings.sent2: The delicious meal galed the guests at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cozy fireplace galed the family on a cold night.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt apology galed her heart with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The successful project completion galed the team with pride.
